60  /**
61   * Class that handles the source of a replication stream.
62   * Currently does not handle more than 1 slave
63   * For each slave cluster it selects a random number of peers
64   * using a replication ratio. For example, if replication ration = 0.1
65   * and slave cluster has 100 region servers, 10 will be selected.
66   * <p/>
67   * A stream is considered down when we cannot contact a region server on the
68   * peer cluster for more than 55 seconds by default.
69   * <p/>
70   *
71   */
72  @InterfaceAudience.Private
73  public class ReplicationSource extends Thread
74      implements ReplicationSourceInterface {
75  
76    public static final Log LOG = LogFactory.getLog(ReplicationSource.class);
77    // Queue of logs to process
78    private PriorityBlockingQueue<Path> queue;
79    private HConnection conn;
80    private ReplicationQueues replicationQueues;
81    private ReplicationPeers replicationPeers;
82    private Configuration conf;
83    private ReplicationQueueInfo replicationQueueInfo;
84    // id of the peer cluster this source replicates to
85    private String peerId;
86    // The manager of all sources to which we ping back our progress
87    private ReplicationSourceManager manager;
88    // Should we stop everything?
89    private Stoppable stopper;
90    // How long should we sleep for each retry
91    private long sleepForRetries;
92    // Max size in bytes of entriesArray
93    private long replicationQueueSizeCapacity;
94    // Max number of entries in entriesArray
95    private int replicationQueueNbCapacity;
96    // Our reader for the current log
97    private HLog.Reader reader;
98    // Last position in the log that we sent to ZooKeeper
99    private long lastLoggedPosition = -1;
100   // Path of the current log
101   private volatile Path currentPath;
102   private FileSystem fs;
103   // id of this cluster
104   private UUID clusterId;
105   // id of the other cluster
106   private UUID peerClusterId;
107   // total number of edits we replicated
108   private long totalReplicatedEdits = 0;
109   // total number of edits we replicated
110   private long totalReplicatedOperations = 0;
111   // The znode we currently play with
112   private String peerClusterZnode;
113   // Maximum number of retries before taking bold actions
114   private int maxRetriesMultiplier;
115   // Socket timeouts require even bolder actions since we don't want to DDOS
116   private int socketTimeoutMultiplier;
117   // Current number of operations (Put/Delete) that we need to replicate
118   private int currentNbOperations = 0;
119   // Current size of data we need to replicate
120   private int currentSize = 0;
121   // Indicates if this particular source is running
122   private volatile boolean running = true;
123   // Metrics for this source
124   private MetricsSource metrics;
125   // Handle on the log reader helper
126   private ReplicationHLogReaderManager repLogReader;
127   // Handles connecting to peer region servers
128   private ReplicationSinkManager replicationSinkMgr;
129   //WARN threshold for the number of queued logs, defaults to 2
130   private int logQueueWarnThreshold;

132   /**
133    * Instantiation method used by region servers
134    *
135    * @param conf configuration to use
136    * @param fs file system to use
137    * @param manager replication manager to ping to
138    * @param stopper     the atomic boolean to use to stop the regionserver
139    * @param peerClusterZnode the name of our znode
140    * @throws IOException
141    */
142   public void init(final Configuration conf, final FileSystem fs,
143       final ReplicationSourceManager manager, final ReplicationQueues replicationQueues,
144       final ReplicationPeers replicationPeers, final Stoppable stopper,
145       final String peerClusterZnode, final UUID clusterId) throws IOException {
146     this.stopper = stopper;
147     this.conf = conf;
148     this.replicationQueueSizeCapacity =
149         this.conf.getLong("replication.source.size.capacity", 1024*1024*64);
150     this.replicationQueueNbCapacity =
151         this.conf.getInt("replication.source.nb.capacity", 25000);
152     this.maxRetriesMultiplier = this.conf.getInt("replication.source.maxretriesmultiplier", 10);
153     this.socketTimeoutMultiplier = this.conf.getInt("replication.source.socketTimeoutMultiplier",
154         maxRetriesMultiplier * maxRetriesMultiplier);
155     this.queue =
156         new PriorityBlockingQueue<Path>(
157             conf.getInt("hbase.regionserver.maxlogs", 32),
158             new LogsComparator());
159     // TODO: This connection is replication specific or we should make it particular to
160     // replication and make replication specific settings such as compression or codec to use
161     // passing Cells.
162     this.conn = HConnectionManager.getConnection(conf);
163     this.replicationQueues = replicationQueues;
164     this.replicationPeers = replicationPeers;
165     this.manager = manager;
166     this.sleepForRetries =
167         this.conf.getLong("replication.source.sleepforretries", 1000);
168     this.fs = fs;
169     this.metrics = new MetricsSource(peerClusterZnode);
170     this.repLogReader = new ReplicationHLogReaderManager(this.fs, this.conf);
171     this.clusterId = clusterId;
172 
173     this.peerClusterZnode = peerClusterZnode;
174     this.replicationQueueInfo = new ReplicationQueueInfo(peerClusterZnode);
175     // ReplicationQueueInfo parses the peerId out of the znode for us
176     this.peerId = this.replicationQueueInfo.getPeerId();
177     this.replicationSinkMgr = new ReplicationSinkManager(conn, peerId, replicationPeers, conf);
178     this.logQueueWarnThreshold = this.conf.getInt("replication.source.log.queue.warn", 2);
179   }
180 
181 
182   @Override
183   public void enqueueLog(Path log) {
184     this.queue.put(log);
185     int queueSize = queue.size();
186     this.metrics.setSizeOfLogQueue(queueSize);
187     // This will log a warning for each new log that gets created above the warn threshold
188     if (queueSize > this.logQueueWarnThreshold) {
189       LOG.warn("Queue size: " + queueSize +
190         " exceeds value of replication.source.log.queue.warn: " + logQueueWarnThreshold);
191     }
192   }
193 
194   @Override
195   public void run() {
196     connectToPeers();
197     // We were stopped while looping to connect to sinks, just abort
198     if (!this.isActive()) {
199       metrics.clear();
200       return;
201     }
202     int sleepMultiplier = 1;
203     // delay this until we are in an asynchronous thread
204     while (this.peerClusterId == null) {
205       this.peerClusterId = replicationPeers.getPeerUUID(this.peerId);
206       if (this.peerClusterId == null) {
207         if (sleepForRetries("Cannot contact the peer's zk ensemble", sleepMultiplier)) {
208           sleepMultiplier++;
209         }
210       }
211     }
212     // resetting to 1 to reuse later
213     sleepMultiplier = 1;
214 
215     // In rare case, zookeeper setting may be messed up. That leads to the incorrect
216     // peerClusterId value, which is the same as the source clusterId
217     if (clusterId.equals(peerClusterId)) {
218       this.terminate("ClusterId " + clusterId + " is replicating to itself: peerClusterId "
219           + peerClusterId);
220     }
221     LOG.info("Replicating "+clusterId + " -> " + peerClusterId);
222 
223     // If this is recovered, the queue is already full and the first log
224     // normally has a position (unless the RS failed between 2 logs)
225     if (this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered()) {
226       try {
227         this.repLogReader.setPosition(this.replicationQueues.getLogPosition(this.peerClusterZnode,
228           this.queue.peek().getName()));
229         if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
230           LOG.trace("Recovered queue started with log " + this.queue.peek() +
231               " at position " + this.repLogReader.getPosition());
232         }
233       } catch (ReplicationException e) {
234         this.terminate("Couldn't get the position of this recovered queue " +
235             this.peerClusterZnode, e);
236       }
237     }
238     // Loop until we close down
239     while (isActive()) {
240       // Sleep until replication is enabled again
241       if (!isPeerEnabled()) {
242         if (sleepForRetries("Replication is disabled", sleepMultiplier)) {
243           sleepMultiplier++;
244         }
245         continue;
246       }
247       Path oldPath = getCurrentPath(); //note that in the current scenario,
248                                        //oldPath will be null when a log roll
249                                        //happens.
250       // Get a new path
251       boolean hasCurrentPath = getNextPath();
252       if (getCurrentPath() != null && oldPath == null) {
253         sleepMultiplier = 1; //reset the sleepMultiplier on a path change
254       }
255       if (!hasCurrentPath) {
256         if (sleepForRetries("No log to process", sleepMultiplier)) {
257           sleepMultiplier++;
258         }
259         continue;
260       }
261       boolean currentWALisBeingWrittenTo = false;
262       //For WAL files we own (rather than recovered), take a snapshot of whether the
263       //current WAL file (this.currentPath) is in use (for writing) NOW!
264       //Since the new WAL paths are enqueued only after the prev WAL file
265       //is 'closed', presence of an element in the queue means that
266       //the previous WAL file was closed, else the file is in use (currentPath)
267       //We take the snapshot now so that we are protected against races
268       //where a new file gets enqueued while the current file is being processed
269       //(and where we just finished reading the current file).
270       if (!this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered() && queue.size() == 0) {
271         currentWALisBeingWrittenTo = true;
272       }
273       // Open a reader on it
274       if (!openReader(sleepMultiplier)) {
275         // Reset the sleep multiplier, else it'd be reused for the next file
276         sleepMultiplier = 1;
277         continue;
278       }
279 
280       // If we got a null reader but didn't continue, then sleep and continue
281       if (this.reader == null) {
282         if (sleepForRetries("Unable to open a reader", sleepMultiplier)) {
283           sleepMultiplier++;
284         }
285         continue;
286       }
287 
288       boolean gotIOE = false;
289       currentNbOperations = 0;
290       List<HLog.Entry> entries = new ArrayList<HLog.Entry>(1);
291       currentSize = 0;
292       try {
293         if (readAllEntriesToReplicateOrNextFile(currentWALisBeingWrittenTo, entries)) {
294           continue;
295         }
296       } catch (IOException ioe) {
297         LOG.warn(this.peerClusterZnode + " Got: ", ioe);
298         gotIOE = true;
299         if (ioe.getCause() instanceof EOFException) {
300 
301           boolean considerDumping = false;
302           if (this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered()) {
303             try {
304               FileStatus stat = this.fs.getFileStatus(this.currentPath);
305               if (stat.getLen() == 0) {
306                 LOG.warn(this.peerClusterZnode + " Got EOF and the file was empty");
307               }
308               considerDumping = true;
309             } catch (IOException e) {
310               LOG.warn(this.peerClusterZnode + " Got while getting file size: ", e);
311             }
312           }
313 
314           if (considerDumping &&
315               sleepMultiplier == this.maxRetriesMultiplier &&
316               processEndOfFile()) {
317             continue;
318           }
319         }
320       } finally {
321         try {
322           this.reader = null;
323           this.repLogReader.closeReader();
324         } catch (IOException e) {
325           gotIOE = true;
326           LOG.warn("Unable to finalize the tailing of a file", e);
327         }
328       }
329 
330       // If we didn't get anything to replicate, or if we hit a IOE,
331       // wait a bit and retry.
332       // But if we need to stop, don't bother sleeping
333       if (this.isActive() && (gotIOE || entries.isEmpty())) {
334         if (this.lastLoggedPosition != this.repLogReader.getPosition()) {
335           this.manager.logPositionAndCleanOldLogs(this.currentPath,
336               this.peerClusterZnode, this.repLogReader.getPosition(),
337               this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered(), currentWALisBeingWrittenTo);
338           this.lastLoggedPosition = this.repLogReader.getPosition();
339         }
340         // Reset the sleep multiplier if nothing has actually gone wrong
341         if (!gotIOE) {
342           sleepMultiplier = 1;
343         }
344         if (sleepForRetries("Nothing to replicate", sleepMultiplier)) {
345           sleepMultiplier++;
346         }
347         continue;
348       }
349       sleepMultiplier = 1;
350       shipEdits(currentWALisBeingWrittenTo, entries);
351     }
352     if (this.conn != null) {
353       try {
354         this.conn.close();
355       } catch (IOException e) {
356         LOG.debug("Attempt to close connection failed", e);
357       }
358     }
359     LOG.debug("Source exiting " + this.peerId);
360     metrics.clear();
361   }
362 
363   /**
364    * Read all the entries from the current log files and retain those
365    * that need to be replicated. Else, process the end of the current file.
366    * @param currentWALisBeingWrittenTo is the current WAL being written to
367    * @param entries resulting entries to be replicated
368    * @return true if we got nothing and went to the next file, false if we got
369    * entries
370    * @throws IOException
371    */
372   protected boolean readAllEntriesToReplicateOrNextFile(boolean currentWALisBeingWrittenTo, List<HLog.Entry> entries)
373       throws IOException{
374     long seenEntries = 0;
375     if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
376       LOG.trace("Seeking in " + this.currentPath + " at position "
377           + this.repLogReader.getPosition());
378     }
379     this.repLogReader.seek();
380     HLog.Entry entry =
381         this.repLogReader.readNextAndSetPosition();
382     while (entry != null) {
383       WALEdit edit = entry.getEdit();
384       this.metrics.incrLogEditsRead();
385       seenEntries++;
386       // Remove all KVs that should not be replicated
387       HLogKey logKey = entry.getKey();
388       // don't replicate if the log entries have already been consumed by the cluster
389       if (!logKey.getClusterIds().contains(peerClusterId)) {
390         removeNonReplicableEdits(entry);
391         // Don't replicate catalog entries, if the WALEdit wasn't
392         // containing anything to replicate and if we're currently not set to replicate
393         if (!logKey.getTablename().equals(TableName.META_TABLE_NAME) &&
394             edit.size() != 0) {
395           //Mark that the current cluster has the change
396           logKey.addClusterId(clusterId);
397           currentNbOperations += countDistinctRowKeys(edit);
398           entries.add(entry);
399           currentSize += entry.getEdit().heapSize();
400         } else {
401           this.metrics.incrLogEditsFiltered();
402         }
403       }
404       // Stop if too many entries or too big
405       if (currentSize >= this.replicationQueueSizeCapacity ||
406           entries.size() >= this.replicationQueueNbCapacity) {
407         break;
408       }
409       try {
410         entry = this.repLogReader.readNextAndSetPosition();
411       } catch (IOException ie) {
412         LOG.debug("Break on IOE: " + ie.getMessage());
413         break;
414       }
415     }
416     if (currentWALisBeingWrittenTo) {
417       return false;
418     }
419     // If we didn't get anything and the queue has an object, it means we
420     // hit the end of the file for sure
421     return seenEntries == 0 && processEndOfFile();
422   }
423 
424   private void connectToPeers() {
425     int sleepMultiplier = 1;
426 
427     // Connect to peer cluster first, unless we have to stop
428     while (this.isActive() && replicationSinkMgr.getSinks().size() == 0) {
429       replicationSinkMgr.chooseSinks();
430       if (this.isActive() && replicationSinkMgr.getSinks().size() == 0) {
431         if (sleepForRetries("Waiting for peers", sleepMultiplier)) {
432           sleepMultiplier++;
433         }
434       }
435     }
436   }
437 
438   /**
439    * Poll for the next path
440    * @return true if a path was obtained, false if not
441    */
442   protected boolean getNextPath() {
443     try {
444       if (this.currentPath == null) {
445         this.currentPath = queue.poll(this.sleepForRetries, TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
446         this.metrics.setSizeOfLogQueue(queue.size());
447         if (this.currentPath != null) {
448           this.manager.cleanOldLogs(this.currentPath.getName(),
449               this.peerId,
450               this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered());
451           if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
452             LOG.trace("New log: " + this.currentPath);
453           }
454         }
455       }
456     } catch (InterruptedException e) {
457       LOG.warn("Interrupted while reading edits", e);
458     }
459     return this.currentPath != null;
460   }
461 
462   /**
463    * Open a reader on the current path
464    *
465    * @param sleepMultiplier by how many times the default sleeping time is augmented
466    * @return true if we should continue with that file, false if we are over with it
467    */
468   protected boolean openReader(int sleepMultiplier) {
469     try {
470       try {
471         if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
472           LOG.trace("Opening log " + this.currentPath);
473         }
474         this.reader = repLogReader.openReader(this.currentPath);
475       } catch (FileNotFoundException fnfe) {
476         if (this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered()) {
477           // We didn't find the log in the archive directory, look if it still
478           // exists in the dead RS folder (there could be a chain of failures
479           // to look at)
480           List<String> deadRegionServers = this.replicationQueueInfo.getDeadRegionServers();
481           LOG.info("NB dead servers : " + deadRegionServers.size());
482           for (String curDeadServerName : deadRegionServers) {
483             Path deadRsDirectory =
484                 new Path(manager.getLogDir().getParent(), curDeadServerName);
485             Path[] locs = new Path[] {
486                 new Path(deadRsDirectory, currentPath.getName()),
487                 new Path(deadRsDirectory.suffix(HLog.SPLITTING_EXT),
488                                           currentPath.getName()),
489             };
490             for (Path possibleLogLocation : locs) {
491               LOG.info("Possible location " + possibleLogLocation.toUri().toString());
492               if (this.manager.getFs().exists(possibleLogLocation)) {
493                 // We found the right new location
494                 LOG.info("Log " + this.currentPath + " still exists at " +
495                     possibleLogLocation);
496                 // Breaking here will make us sleep since reader is null
497                 return true;
498               }
499             }
500           }
501           // In the case of disaster/recovery, HMaster may be shutdown/crashed before flush data
502           // from .logs to .oldlogs. Loop into .logs folders and check whether a match exists
503           if (stopper instanceof ReplicationSyncUp.DummyServer) {
504             FileStatus[] rss = fs.listStatus(manager.getLogDir());
505             for (FileStatus rs : rss) {
506               Path p = rs.getPath();
507               FileStatus[] logs = fs.listStatus(p);
508               for (FileStatus log : logs) {
509                 p = new Path(p, log.getPath().getName());
510                 if (p.getName().equals(currentPath.getName())) {
511                   currentPath = p;
512                   LOG.info("Log " + this.currentPath + " exists under " + manager.getLogDir());
513                   // Open the log at the new location
514                   this.openReader(sleepMultiplier);
515                   return true;
516                 }
517               }
518             }
519           }
520 
521           // TODO What happens if the log was missing from every single location?
522           // Although we need to check a couple of times as the log could have
523           // been moved by the master between the checks
524           // It can also happen if a recovered queue wasn't properly cleaned,
525           // such that the znode pointing to a log exists but the log was
526           // deleted a long time ago.
527           // For the moment, we'll throw the IO and processEndOfFile
528           throw new IOException("File from recovered queue is " +
529               "nowhere to be found", fnfe);
530         } else {
531           // If the log was archived, continue reading from there
532           Path archivedLogLocation =
533               new Path(manager.getOldLogDir(), currentPath.getName());
534           if (this.manager.getFs().exists(archivedLogLocation)) {
535             currentPath = archivedLogLocation;
536             LOG.info("Log " + this.currentPath + " was moved to " +
537                 archivedLogLocation);
538             // Open the log at the new location
539             this.openReader(sleepMultiplier);
540 
541           }
542           // TODO What happens the log is missing in both places?
543         }
544       }
545     } catch (IOException ioe) {
546       if (ioe instanceof EOFException && isCurrentLogEmpty()) return true;
547       LOG.warn(this.peerClusterZnode + " Got: ", ioe);
548       this.reader = null;
549       if (ioe.getCause() instanceof NullPointerException) {
550         // Workaround for race condition in HDFS-4380
551         // which throws a NPE if we open a file before any data node has the most recent block
552         // Just sleep and retry. Will require re-reading compressed HLogs for compressionContext.
553         LOG.warn("Got NPE opening reader, will retry.");
554       } else if (sleepMultiplier == this.maxRetriesMultiplier) {
555         // TODO Need a better way to determine if a file is really gone but
556         // TODO without scanning all logs dir
557         LOG.warn("Waited too long for this file, considering dumping");
558         return !processEndOfFile();
559       }
560     }
561     return true;
562   }
563 
564   /*
565    * Checks whether the current log file is empty, and it is not a recovered queue. This is to
566    * handle scenario when in an idle cluster, there is no entry in the current log and we keep on
567    * trying to read the log file and get EOFEception. In case of a recovered queue the last log file
568    * may be empty, and we don't want to retry that.
569    */
570   private boolean isCurrentLogEmpty() {
571     return (this.repLogReader.getPosition() == 0 &&
572         !this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered() && queue.size() == 0);
573   }
574 
575   /**
576    * Do the sleeping logic
577    * @param msg Why we sleep
578    * @param sleepMultiplier by how many times the default sleeping time is augmented
579    * @return True if <code>sleepMultiplier</code> is &lt; <code>maxRetriesMultiplier</code>
580    */
581   protected boolean sleepForRetries(String msg, int sleepMultiplier) {
582     try {
583       if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
584         LOG.trace(msg + ", sleeping " + sleepForRetries + " times " + sleepMultiplier);
585       }
586       Thread.sleep(this.sleepForRetries * sleepMultiplier);
587     } catch (InterruptedException e) {
588       LOG.debug("Interrupted while sleeping between retries");
589     }
590     return sleepMultiplier < maxRetriesMultiplier;
591   }
592 
593   /**
594    * We only want KVs that are scoped other than local
595    * @param entry The entry to check for replication
596    */
597   protected void removeNonReplicableEdits(HLog.Entry entry) {
598     NavigableMap<byte[], Integer> scopes = entry.getKey().getScopes();
599     ArrayList<KeyValue> kvs = entry.getEdit().getKeyValues();
600     int size = kvs.size();
601     for (int i = size-1; i >= 0; i--) {
602       KeyValue kv = kvs.get(i);
603       // The scope will be null or empty if
604       // there's nothing to replicate in that WALEdit
605       if (scopes == null || !scopes.containsKey(kv.getFamily())) {
606         kvs.remove(i);
607       }
608     }
609     if (kvs.size() < size/2) {
610       kvs.trimToSize();
611     }
612   }
613 
614   /**
615    * Count the number of different row keys in the given edit because of
616    * mini-batching. We assume that there's at least one KV in the WALEdit.
617    * @param edit edit to count row keys from
618    * @return number of different row keys
619    */
620   private int countDistinctRowKeys(WALEdit edit) {
621     List<KeyValue> kvs = edit.getKeyValues();
622     int distinctRowKeys = 1;
623     KeyValue lastKV = kvs.get(0);
624     for (int i = 0; i < edit.size(); i++) {
625       if (!kvs.get(i).matchingRow(lastKV)) {
626         distinctRowKeys++;
627       }
628     }
629     return distinctRowKeys;
630   }
631 
632   /**
633    * Do the shipping logic
634    * @param currentWALisBeingWrittenTo was the current WAL being (seemingly)
635    * written to when this method was called
636    */
637   protected void shipEdits(boolean currentWALisBeingWrittenTo, List<HLog.Entry> entries) {
638     int sleepMultiplier = 1;
639     if (entries.isEmpty()) {
640       LOG.warn("Was given 0 edits to ship");
641       return;
642     }
643     while (this.isActive()) {
644       if (!isPeerEnabled()) {
645         if (sleepForRetries("Replication is disabled", sleepMultiplier)) {
646           sleepMultiplier++;
647         }
648         continue;
649       }
650       SinkPeer sinkPeer = null;
651       try {
652         sinkPeer = replicationSinkMgr.getReplicationSink();
653         BlockingInterface rrs = sinkPeer.getRegionServer();
654         if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
655           LOG.trace("Replicating " + entries.size() +
656               " entries of total size " + currentSize);
657         }
658         ReplicationProtbufUtil.replicateWALEntry(rrs,
659             entries.toArray(new HLog.Entry[entries.size()]));
660         if (this.lastLoggedPosition != this.repLogReader.getPosition()) {
661           this.manager.logPositionAndCleanOldLogs(this.currentPath,
662               this.peerClusterZnode, this.repLogReader.getPosition(),
663               this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered(), currentWALisBeingWrittenTo);
664           this.lastLoggedPosition = this.repLogReader.getPosition();
665         }
666         this.totalReplicatedEdits += entries.size();
667         this.totalReplicatedOperations += currentNbOperations;
668         this.metrics.shipBatch(this.currentNbOperations);
669         this.metrics.setAgeOfLastShippedOp(entries.get(entries.size()-1).getKey().getWriteTime());
670         if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
671           LOG.trace("Replicated " + this.totalReplicatedEdits + " entries in total, or "
672               + this.totalReplicatedOperations + " operations");
673         }
674         break;
675 
676       } catch (IOException ioe) {
677         // Didn't ship anything, but must still age the last time we did
678         this.metrics.refreshAgeOfLastShippedOp();
679         if (ioe instanceof RemoteException) {
680           ioe = ((RemoteException) ioe).unwrapRemoteException();
681           LOG.warn("Can't replicate because of an error on the remote cluster: ", ioe);
682           if (ioe instanceof TableNotFoundException) {
683             if (sleepForRetries("A table is missing in the peer cluster. "
684                 + "Replication cannot proceed without losing data.", sleepMultiplier)) {
685               sleepMultiplier++;
686             }
687           }
688         } else {
689           if (ioe instanceof SocketTimeoutException) {
690             // This exception means we waited for more than 60s and nothing
691             // happened, the cluster is alive and calling it right away
692             // even for a test just makes things worse.
693             sleepForRetries("Encountered a SocketTimeoutException. Since the " +
694               "call to the remote cluster timed out, which is usually " +
695               "caused by a machine failure or a massive slowdown",
696               this.socketTimeoutMultiplier);
697           } else if (ioe instanceof ConnectException) {
698             LOG.warn("Peer is unavailable, rechecking all sinks: ", ioe);
699             replicationSinkMgr.chooseSinks();
700           } else {
701             LOG.warn("Can't replicate because of a local or network error: ", ioe);
702           }
703         }
704 
705         if (sinkPeer != null) {
706           replicationSinkMgr.reportBadSink(sinkPeer);
707         }
708         if (sleepForRetries("Since we are unable to replicate", sleepMultiplier)) {
709           sleepMultiplier++;
710         }
711       }
712     }
713   }

715   /**
716    * check whether the peer is enabled or not
717    *
718    * @return true if the peer is enabled, otherwise false
719    */
720   protected boolean isPeerEnabled() {
721     return this.replicationPeers.getStatusOfConnectedPeer(this.peerId);
722   }
723 
724   /**
725    * If the queue isn't empty, switch to the next one
726    * Else if this is a recovered queue, it means we're done!
727    * Else we'll just continue to try reading the log file
728    * @return true if we're done with the current file, false if we should
729    * continue trying to read from it
730    */
731   protected boolean processEndOfFile() {
732     if (this.queue.size() != 0) {
733       if (LOG.isTraceEnabled()) {
734         String filesize = "N/A";
735         try {
736           FileStatus stat = this.fs.getFileStatus(this.currentPath);
737           filesize = stat.getLen()+"";
738         } catch (IOException ex) {}
739         LOG.trace("Reached the end of a log, stats: " + getStats() +
740             ", and the length of the file is " + filesize);
741       }
742       this.currentPath = null;
743       this.repLogReader.finishCurrentFile();
744       this.reader = null;
745       return true;
746     } else if (this.replicationQueueInfo.isQueueRecovered()) {
747       this.manager.closeRecoveredQueue(this);
748       LOG.info("Finished recovering the queue with the following stats " + getStats());
749       this.running = false;
750       return true;
751     }
752     return false;
753   }

755   public void startup() {
756     String n = Thread.currentThread().getName();
757     Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler handler =
758         new Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler() {
759           public void uncaughtException(final Thread t, final Throwable e) {
760             LOG.error("Unexpected exception in ReplicationSource," +
761               " currentPath=" + currentPath, e);
762           }
763         };
764     Threads.setDaemonThreadRunning(
765         this, n + ".replicationSource," +
766         this.peerClusterZnode, handler);
767   }

769   public void terminate(String reason) {
770     terminate(reason, null);
771   }
772 
773   public void terminate(String reason, Exception cause) {
774     if (cause == null) {
775       LOG.info("Closing source "
776           + this.peerClusterZnode + " because: " + reason);
777 
778     } else {
779       LOG.error("Closing source " + this.peerClusterZnode
780           + " because an error occurred: " + reason, cause);
781     }
782     this.running = false;
783     Threads.shutdown(this, this.sleepForRetries);
784   }

798   private boolean isActive() {

802   /**
803    * Comparator used to compare logs together based on their start time
804    */
805   public static class LogsComparator implements Comparator<Path> {
806 
807     @Override
808     public int compare(Path o1, Path o2) {
809       return Long.valueOf(getTS(o1)).compareTo(getTS(o2));
810     }
811 
812     /**
813      * Split a path to get the start time
814      * For example: 10.20.20.171%3A60020.1277499063250
815      * @param p path to split
816      * @return start time
817      */
818     private long getTS(Path p) {
819       String[] parts = p.getName().split("\\.");
820       return Long.parseLong(parts[parts.length-1]);
821     }
822   }

824   @Override
825   public String getStats() {
826     long position = this.repLogReader.getPosition();
827     return "Total replicated edits: " + totalReplicatedEdits +
828       ", currently replicating from: " + this.currentPath +
829       " at position: " + position;
830   }
